definition: to shake off/to get rid of
to throw/to fling/to swing/to leave behind/to throw off/to dump (sb)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to throw off inhibitions/to go all out

sentences.english: Boyle threw open the door of the truck and started running after the car.
sentences.chinese: 博伊爾當即甩開卡車的門朝那輛雪佛蘭跑去。

sentences.english: Dongshuji of green county with the transfer of the wounded, they take the pursuer.
sentences.chinese: 青順縣的董書記帶着傷員轉移，他們甩開了追軍。

sentences.english: They also bring into their relationships a full trunk of financial baggage that can't be kicked curbside.
sentences.chinese: 他們也帶進去了一大推無法甩開的經濟包袱。

sentences.english: I almost never look at a profit and loss statement without also looking at a balance sheet.
sentences.chinese: 我幾乎從來不會甩開資產負債表而單獨地看損益表。

sentences.english: By this measure the recession is very much behind us.
sentences.chinese: 按這種方法衡量，我們已經遠遠甩開了經濟衰退。

sentences.english: Da GuEn want and Gu Man further relationship, to be Gu Man off again.
sentences.chinese: 達谷恩想要和顧曼進一步關係，再次被顧曼甩開。

sentences.english: QUARITCH flings him off with a sweep of his arm, and Jake slams to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 誇裏奇橫掃手臂將他甩開，傑克被砸到地面上。

definition: to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to dodge/to evade
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
right away/quickly/immediately
to block sb's path/to obstruct/to flag down (a taxi)
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
to abuse roundly
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to damn/to curse/to revile
to shiver
subconscious mind
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to hold firmly, not let go
